fields.description:
WHY ROBLOX?

Roblox’s mission is to bring the world together through play. Every month, more than 115 million people around the world have fun with friends as they explore millions of immersive digital experiences. We believe in building a safe, civil, and diverse community—one that inspires and fosters creativity and positive relationships between people around the world. 

We are committed to building the next generation of entertainment—allowing people to imagine, create, and play together in an endless array of user-generated worlds. All of these experiences are built by the Roblox community, made up of over two million creators.

We’re looking for someone who’s eager to take on a meaningful role and contribute to the meteoric success of Roblox. We want team members who believe in the power of play and take it seriously, but aren’t afraid to have fun while they’re doing it. Are you ready to take Roblox – and your career – to the next level?

Role Overview:

As a Software Engineer, you will be crafting the foremost experience that millions of players engage with daily. You will enhance the way people discover games and play with friends. You will be writing code with an application-first mindset, and be empowered to create cutting-edge systems that solidify Roblox as the paragon of game creation destinations. If you are an expert at developing cutting edge user interfaces, have a passion for creating inspiring code, and are obsessed with presenting beautiful experiences you will be right at home within our highly-skilled and rapidly growing Apps Team. 

You Are:

Experienced: You have 2-5 years of experience working on large scale consumer applications and hold a BS in Computer Science or above.
Fascinated by UX: You love to build delightful user experiences for millions of users.
Curious: You are excited to work on a new UI platform inspired by React and powered the Roblox game engine. Learning new languages and technologies is exciting to you...
Analytical: You love to understand how your users interact with your interface and use the findings to maximize their impact.
Test-driven: TDD is exciting to you, not scary...
Adaptable: You are able to shift focus and enjoy working outside your comfort zone
Team-player: You work with and inspire others around you, taking on tasks for the greater team
You Will:

Build and ship best-in-class features used by hundred of millions of users
Work closely with Product and Design to ensure the product embodies the shared vision
Use best programming practices, optimizing code to be performant
Write and maintain unit and integration test
Self-organize and take ownership of projects throughout its full lifecycle
Collaborate with numerous internal teams to build the world’s best applications
You'll Love:

Excellent benefits
A rewarding 401k program
Flexible vacation policy
Free catered lunches five times a week and several fully-stocked kitchens with unlimited snacks
Onsite fitness center and fitness program credit
Annual CalTrain Go Pass
A Roblox Admin badge for your avatar

fields.description:
Software Engineer

Location: Flexible

 

Who we are:

 

We’re Prime Matter Labs, a personal care product manufacturer with over 35 years of experience innovating, formulating, and creating products for some of the most successful and respected brands in the world.

 

We exist to produce better products for the world by empowering our customers to bring their best ideas to life. We strive to be their most valuable partner, delivering a level of efficiency, service, and support unmatched in the industry.

 

Starting this year we’re embarking on a bold new vision to be the leading product development and production partner for emerging and established brands. To realize that vision, we’re investing at an unprecedented level in new technology, processes, and plans that will completely rethink the way that brands view and interact with their manufacturer.

 

Come join us in building the platform that will serve as the foundation for our customers’ branded products, from their first sample, to their million unit product run, and every step in between.

 

Who you are:

 

You’re passionate about delivering the best end-to-end experiences for people through technology

You care about software architecture, writing high-quality code, intuitive UX, and the responsibility of code ownership
 

You have 2-7 years experience with modern JavaScript, CSS, and React that includes coding, testing, deploying, and debugging
 

You have 2-7 years experience working in Ruby/Rails or similar backend languages/frameworks
 

You’re experienced in navigating design systems and are comfortable applying UX principles and polish to your work
 

You learn quickly and seek to collaborate, analyze, and iterate in order to overcome challenges and reach the optimal solution
 

What you’ll do:


You’ll be a foundational member of our new technology team, playing an active role in building our early applications, best practices, and culture
 

Use your experience to design intelligent solutions, with the opportunity to greenfield new clients, services, and features end-to-end
 

Collaborate with your teammates to deliver business critical products that will transform the relationship between brands and their manufacturing partner
 

What we’re offering:

 

Competitive compensation package
Health, dental, and vision benefits
401K program
The spirit of a startup with the security of an established, profitable industry leader
The opportunity to make waves in a $250B industry

Description
Internet Brands is currently looking for a Front-End Developer to join our Los Angeles based headquarters.

Responsibilities:
- Develop high-traffic web applications utilizing JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3, AJAX, AngularJS and React.
- Can-do attitude working with global product development teams in an Agile and fast-paced environment.
- Implement platform product features and user interfaces.
- Identify and resolve scalability and performance issues.
- Perform unit and other testing functions, as needed.
- Work with an established team of developers and interact with product managers, marketing teams and designers.
- Ability to complete projects with minimal supervision and direction.

Qualifications:
- 3+ years of programming skills with JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3, SCSS.
- Knowledge of DOM, AJAX, and JSON.
- Strong working knowledge of JavaScript (ex: React, Backbone, AngularJS…).
- Experience with responsive web design.
- Experience in a version control system like Git.
- BS or MS in Computer Science or related field.

About Internet Brands:

Headquartered in El Segundo, Calif., Internet Brands® is a fully integrated online media and software services organization focused on four high-value vertical categories: Health, Automotive, Legal, and Home/Travel. The company's award-winning consumer websites lead their categories and serve more than 250 million monthly visitors, while a full range of web presence offerings has established deep, long-term relationships with SMB and enterprise clients. Internet Brands' powerful, proprietary operating platform provides the flexibility and scalability to fuel the company's continued growth. Internet Brands is a portfolio company of KKR and Temasek. For more information, please visit www.internetbrands.com.

Los Angeles based Internet Brands is currently seeking a PHP & Java Intern to join our web development team. We're looking for an innovative intern who loves the Internet and social media. As an intern, you will work directly with our development teams on consumer-facing websites.

fields.description:
Come join Intuit as a Software Engineer in our London office.


We're looking for an amazing technologist to build great features by experimenting, learning fast, incorporating customer feedback to make QuickBooks Online and Payroll services highly scalable, performant and delightful products for our customers. QuickBooks Online is the world's No. 1 Cloud Accounting solution serving millions of small
& medium businesses worldwide.

 

Imagine working on a product with 4+ million paid users, serving 160+ countries worldwide, multiple languages and releases happening regularly. Current architecture is based in microservices, Java/Spring - back-end, React/Redux, GraphQL. Our Target Architecture follows Domain-Driven Design principles, includes Event Driven Architecture and exploring some exciting ML opportunities. You will be working with one of our scrum teams helping to improve the product in many ways: code quality and great architecture principles, speed, mobile first mindset and deliver customer value!


If you want to be part of something big and special, it’s the job for you. Come join us and be a part of this exciting journey and write history!

Responsibilities
Full-stack design and implementation of the overall web architecture.
You can work with a wide range of technologies and shine on your best strengths.
Help business to deliver great results and value for the customer .
Work cross-functionally with various Intuit teams including product management, UX, various product lines, and/or business units to solve real customer problems.
Gather functional requirements, technical specifications, plan for testing and monitoring.
Solve challenging programming, domain and architectural problems! With well architected and high performant solutions.
Owning the team services/infrastructure and supporting the domain, resolve defects/bugs during testing, pre-production, production.
Qualifications
Proficiency with designing/developing front-end applications: JavaScript / React, SPA.
Expertise with back-end programming: Java / Groovy, SaaS.
Working with web services (consuming or creating) with REST, GraphQL, SOAP.
Experience to setup and manage AWS cloud infrastructure, docker/kubernetes, big data, analytics/monitoring tools.
Knowledgeable or experience with Testing practices (e.g. Test Driven Development)
Experience with the entire Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) working with tools like: Jenkins, Bamboo, Git.
Excellent communication skills: Demonstrated ability to explain complex technical issues to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Capable of working with multiple areas in a company to achieve great results
Capable of bringing new ideas and advocating for them with the wider team
Always Be Learning, Experience with Agile Development.

ID 2020-15653 Category Software Engineering

Overview
 

Intuit is the global leader in financial management software where we have pioneered the shift to Virtual Platforms, cloud computing for consumers, small businesses and those that serve them. Intuit acts as a 35 year old startup, and we are constantly disrupting ourselves as we identify major new technology and design trends that are needed to deliver our mission to power prosperity around the world. Our groups are fast-paced teams focused on delivering innovative capabilities, and having fun while doing it.  

 

Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: Mountain View,San Diego, and the following teams at Intuit.

Responsibilities
Code and implement software solutions that will solve critical customer problems, are scalable, secure, easy to maintain, and interact with numerous other services
Capture requirements and use cases
Partner with other groups both inside and outside of Intuit for cross-functional design, solution integration and on-boarding of mobile/SaaS/PaaS/web/desktop offerings.
Actively stay abreast of mobile/SaaS/PaaS trends and standards, recommend best practices, share learning, and experiment and apply cutting edge technologies/software paradigms (prototypes, patent proposals and engineering process improvements)
 

Your Attributes:

Team player possessing strong analytical, problem solving and communication skills
Ability to influence and communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical people
Ability to work effectively in a fast paced, complex technical environment with high adaptability and flexibility
"Self-starter" attitude and the ability to make decisions independently
Qualifications
Core Skills:

BS/MS in Computer Science or related area or equivalent experience
3+ years total experience delivering enterprise class web applications
2+ years of experience developing software for large business environments (Java/J2EE, Python, Go)
Proven working experience in Java development
Object Oriented analysis and design using common design patterns.
Deep insight of Java and JEE internals
Experience in UI frameworks like React, Backbone, Angular
Excellent knowledge of Relational Databases, SQL and ORM technologies (JPA2, Hibernate)
Experience with test automation: TDD, unit/integration/functional testing.
Solid foundation in writing scalable web application code following best practices of accessibility, internationalization and instrumentation.
 

Desired Skills:

 

Experience in developing applications using microservices, container technologies, container management systems such as Kubernetes, Mesos etc
Experience with Databases design (SQL, NoSQL) and analytics
Experience in utility computing and/or cloud computing domain highly desired
Experience building and deploying applications and services  into cloud environments (AWS highly desired)

fields.description:
Full Stack Engineer
(View all jobs)
San Francisco, California, United States
Description 
6sense is a Predictive Intelligence Engine that is reimagining how B2B companies do sales and marketing. It works with big data at scale, advanced machine learning and predictive modeling to find buyers and predict what they will purchase, when and how much.   

6sense helps B2B marketing and sales organizations fully understand the complex ABM buyer journey. By combining intent signals from every channel with the industry’s most advanced AI predictive capabilities, it is finally possible to predict account demand and optimize demand generation in an ABM world. Equipped with the power of AI and the 6sense Demand Platform™, marketing and sales professionals can uncover, prioritize and engage buyers to drive more revenue. 

https://6sense.com/resources/reports/6sense-named-a-leader-in-the-forrester-new-wave-abm-platforms-q2-2020/

6sense is seeking a Full Stack Engineer to become part of a team designing, developing, and deploying its customer centric applications.  

A Full Stack Engineer at 6sense will have the opportunity to 
Develop new user-facing features  
Build reusable components and front-end libraries 
Optimize components for maximum performance across multiple devices and browsers 
Write performant REST APIs for both internal and external consumption 
Build micro services and their deployment process  
Perform code reviews 
Required qualifications and must have skills 
BE/BTech/BS or equivalent 
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills 
2+ years of experience in one of following  
Python and frameworks like Django 
Java and Spring Boot  
ReactJS and Redux with strong focus on usability design  
Experience with any RDBMS and strong SQL knowledge 
Comfortable with Unix / Linux command line 
Object-oriented concepts & design patterns 
Nice to have Skills 
Experience with Big Data platforms like Hadoop / Hive / Presto 
Experience with ML/AI frameworks like TensorFlow, H20, etc 
Used Key Value stores or noSQL databases 
Good understanding of docker and container platforms like Mesos and Kubernetes 
Security-first architecture approach 
Application benchmarking and optimization  
Interpersonal Attributes 
You can work independently as well as part of a team  
You take ownership of projects and drive them to conclusion 
You’re a good communicator and are capable of not just doing the work, but teaching others and explaining the “why” behind complicated technical decisions 
You aren’t afraid to roll up your sleeves: This role will evolve over time, and we’ll want you to evolve with it! 
 

Apply for this Job* Required
First Name *
Last Name *
Email *
Phone *
Location (City) *
Locate me
 
Resume/CV *
Attach Dropbox Paste
Cover Letter
Attach Dropbox Paste
LinkedIn Profile *
How did you hear about this job? *
I certify that the information provided on this application is true and accurate to the best of knowledge. I understand that withholding of information or giving false information may prevent me from receiving an offer of employment, may result in a withdrawal of an employment offer, or may result in my discharge from employment if I am already employed at the time the false statement or omission is discovered. *

U.S. Equal Opportunity Employment Information (Completion is voluntary)
Individuals seeking employment at 6sense are considered without regards to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, or sexual orientation. You are being given the opportunity to provide the following information in order to help us comply with federal and state Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action record keeping, reporting, and other legal requirements.

Completion of the form is entirely voluntary. Whatever your decision, it will not be considered in the hiring process or thereafter. Any information that you do provide will be recorded and maintained in a confidential file.

Gender

Are you Hispanic/Latino?

Race & Ethnicity Definitions
If you believe you belong to any of the categories of protected veterans listed below, please indicate by making the appropriate selection. As a government contractor subject to Vietnam Era Veterans Readjustment Assistance Act (VEVRAA), we request this information in order to measure the effectiveness of the outreach and positive recruitment efforts we undertake pursuant to VEVRAA. Classification of protected categories is as follows:

A "disabled veteran" is one of the following: a veteran of the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service who is entitled to compensation (or who but for the receipt of military retired pay would be entitled to compensation) under laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs; or a person who was discharged or released from active duty because of a service-connected disability.

A "recently separated veteran" means any veteran during the three-year period beginning on the date of such veteran's discharge or release from active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval, or air service.

An "active duty wartime or campaign badge veteran" means a veteran who served on active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service during a war, or in a campaign or expedition for which a campaign badge has been authorized under the laws administered by the Department of Defense.

An "Armed forces service medal veteran" means a veteran who, while serving on active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service, participated in a United States military operation for which an Armed Forces service medal was awarded pursuant to Executive Order 12985.

Veteran Status

Form CC-305

OMB Control Number 1250-0005

Expires 05/31/2023

Voluntary Self-Identification of Disability
Why are you being asked to complete this form?
We are a federal contractor or subcontractor required by law to provide equal employment opportunity to qualified people with disabilities. We are also required to measure our progress toward having at least 7% of our workforce be individuals with disabilities. To do this, we must ask applicants and employees if they have a disability or have ever had a disability. Because a person may become disabled at any time, we ask all of our employees to update their information at least every five years.

Identifying yourself as an individual with a disability is voluntary, and we hope that you will choose to do so. Your answer will be maintained confidentially and not be seen by selecting officials or anyone else involved in making personnel decisions. Completing the form will not negatively impact you in any way, regardless of whether you have self-identified in the past. For more information about this form or the equal employment obligations of federal contractors under Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act, visit the U.S. Department of Labor’s Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs (OFCCP) website at www.dol.gov/ofccp.

How do you know if you have a disability?
You are considered to have a disability if you have a physical or mental impairment or medical condition that substantially limits a major life activity, or if you have a history or record of such an impairment or medical condition.

Disabilities include, but are not limited to:

Autism
Autoimmune disorder, for example, lupus, fibromyalgia, rheumatoid arthritis, or HIV/AIDS
Blind or low vision
Cancer
Cardiovascular or heart disease
Celiac disease
Cerebral palsy
Deaf or hard of hearing
Depression or anxiety
Diabetes
Epilepsy
Gastrointestinal disorders, for example, Crohn's Disease, or irritable bowel syndrome
Intellectual disability
Missing limbs or partially missing limbs
Nervous system condition for example, migraine headaches, Parkinson’s disease, or Multiple sclerosis (MS)
Psychiatric condition, for example, bipolar disorder, schizophrenia, PTSD, or major depression
Disability Status

1Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, as amended. For more information about this form or the equal employment obligations of Federal contractors, visit the U.S. Department of Labor's Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs (OFCCP) website at www.dol.gov/ofccp.

Work with designers to help consolidate disparate program functions into a unified whole. Work with programmers and coders to help map out various programming tasks and smaller functions, which are then combined into larger, functioning programs or new features for existing software.

How we hire
Blog
Jobs
PHP Backend Software Engineer
Amsterdam
Development
This is Adyen

We took an unobvious approach to starting a payments company, building a platform from scratch. Today, we're the payments platform of choice for the world's brightest companies. Speed is the foundation of our company. We think fast. We work fast. We launch fast. We are honest, direct, and try to have some fun too. We’re creating our own path, with a global team driving sustainable growth. To maintain our momentum, we need people to join us in finding new ways of solving our unique challenges - people like you..

PHP Backend Developer

We are looking for a Backend Developer to join our team in Amsterdam. In this role you will be responsible for building new plug-ins that communicate with the Adyen Platform. You will also be responsible for adding new features to the current eCommerce plugins such as Magento 2, Prestashop, Shopware 5 and 6 and PHP API library.

You already have some eCommerce knowledge along with detailed knowledge of PHP and JavaScript. You enjoy working with people and creating products that they will use. As such, you have the opportunity to interact with both engineering teams and business stakeholders, while managing your own products. Our ecommerce customers expect proactive communication and constant innovation. Your responsibilities are fundamental to Adyen’s success.

What you’ll do

Develop new features for our eCommerce plug-ins and support our merchants.
Communicate daily with internal and external clients to ensure projects progress smoothly and deliverables are met on time.
Design and implement an appropriate integration approach to optimize the business performance of our clients.
Become an Adyen product expert as well as gain payment industry knowledge.
Have the chance to work around the globe as part of our knowledge sharing program.
Become part of the eCommerce developer community and attend different eCommerce events.
Our expectations

Specific technical knowledge in PHP (frameworks such as Symfony and platforms such as Magento2, Prestashop and Shopware is a plus), Javascript, HTML and CSS.
Good understanding of using GIT (GitHub is a plus).
Detail-oriented and have the ability to work on multiple integrations in parallel.
Experience in managing customer relationships and expectations (internal/external).
Ability to gather technical requirements and develop a plan to execute those requirements.
Experience with creating open API specifications and implementation (REST).
Able to communicate in English.
Who we are

Adyen is the payments platform of choice for many of the world’s leading companies, providing a modern end-to-end infrastructure connecting directly to Visa, Mastercard, and consumers' globally preferred payment methods. Adyen delivers frictionless payments across online, mobile, and in-store channels. With offices around the world, Adyen serves nine of the 10 largest U.S. internet companies and many worldwide retailers. Customers include Facebook, Uber, L'Oreal, Booking.com, Bonobos, and Spotify.

Ready to meet us?

If you are excited about this role and looking for a new challenge, apply by clicking the below link. We can’t wait to meet you!

The Adyen Formula
How we work together is guided by the Adyen Formula. These eight principles are not constant – but constantly evolving to keep pace with our merchants, our business and the growth of the team.

Learn more ›
Tech careers
Since building our platform from scratch, our engineers have continuously been reshaping the payments landscape. We’re looking for people who can see the bigger picture and work towards it from inception to implementation.

fields.description:
Logo
AirGarage Software Engineer Application
ABOUT AIRGARAGE 🏙

AirGarage is working to repurpose the 30% of the American city currently occupied by parking.

As a full-stack parking operator, we automate the operation of parking lots and enable churches and businesses to rent out parking to drivers on demand.

Our mission is to restore vibrancy in cities and transform these single-use spaces into multi-use hubs to support a future filled with cloud kitchens, micro-mobility, autonomous vehicles, on-demand fulfillment, and more.

We're backed by Floodgate, Founders Fund, Weekend Fund, and Angels who have worked at Omni, Opendoor, and Uber.

THE ROLE 👩🏾‍💻

We’re looking for a creative software engineer with strong fundamentals and practical projects and experience to join AirGarage. 

Our stack is Python, Django, React Native, and some microservices in Node and Elixir. 

As a startup, we have a variety of ever-changing needs, from new product features to upgrading our codebase to experimental projects in computer vision and license plate recognition. You will contribute to the core product, used by thousands of people per month to pay for parking.

WHAT YOU WILL DO 👷‍♀️

-- Work with the two main facets of AirGarage - the mobile app / web our drivers use to park and the web platform for lot owners.

-- Work across the stack, from backend infra, to production deployment and frontend pages.

-- Work with a variety of the most popular and up-and-coming frameworks, such as Django, React Native, Elxiir, Node, and more.

-- Serve as a cornerstone member of the AirGarage team and have opportunities to lead projects as we scale the engineering organization.
 
-- Ship quickly, but also ensure quality by writing unit and integration tests.

-- Work on internal tools to automate processes and streamline operations.

-- Talk directly to customers to identify and fix paint points while having ownership over the products they use every day.

-- A variety of things we can’t predict - since we are a startup the role is very dynamic.

WHAT YOU NEED 👩🏼‍🎓

-- Strong knowledge of programming principles.

-- Experience with architectural patterns of complex web applications (e.g., well-designed APIs), modern JavaScript libraries and tooling such as React.

-- Side projects -- we are looking for someone who loves hacking and building and demonstrates that by hacking in their free time.

-- A growth mindset -- you should be a lifelong learner, hungry to learn new technologies, frameworks, and programming languages.

THE UPSIDE 📈

-- By joining as one of our early team members, there is enormous opportunity ahead for you to have an outsized impact and shape the future of AirGarage in this role. 

-- We expect base salary to be in the $70k - $100k range initially with upward adjustments post-Series A. Benefits include unlimited PTO, health / dental / vision insurance, 401k, and more.

-- A lot of room to grow -- the engineering team will be orders of magnitude larger within a few years, and you’ll be the foundation of that team. 

-- Work closely with our founders and CTO to drive strategy and execute key initiatives.

-- The opportunity to change the way that the world thinks about real estate use in our cities.

-- A diverse team -- we are 11 people that are 45% female and 36% non-white and we hope to continue hiring thoughtfully to build a team that represents the fact that our customers come from all walks of life.

-- You’ll be joining a sharp, motivated team in a fun and intimate office in San Francisco or remote depending on how 2020 shapes up. :)

Arista Networks
Software Engineer
Santa Clara, CA, USA
Full-time
Job Description
The core responsibility is to deliver product features. A major part of this is writing the code that drives our products. But the role of a software engineer is much bigger than just being a coding machine. Software engineers work on the whole development process, including:

deciding what features to build
driving the design
writing the code (of course)
pushing testing
documenting the feature
supporting customers in the field
Along the way, you might:

extend and improve the test infrastructure
hack on our engineering tools, including p4, django, python, rpm, ...
work with sales and business development
improve the content on our website 
The Person:

If you...

love to program
enjoy building things and shipping them, truly making them work
find satisfaction in creating a really well-written piece of code
care about keeping the code maintainable and preserving its integrity
look for a better way, and strive to make it real
care about the business too
enjoy working with others who feel the same
learn how things work, just for fun or out of curiosity
... then this job is for you.

 

Qualifications
A strong background in Linux, C++, TCP/IP, python, hardware, drivers, compilers, or assembly language is a plus. A BSCS/CE degree is required.

Additional Information
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Airkit Logo
Apply Now
Back End Engineer
at Airkit (View all jobs)
Work from anywhere
About Us
Airkit is on a mission to empower companies to build experiences people love.  People come first in every aspect of what we do, both internally and externally. We are looking for driven and enthusiastic individuals who want to work together to help build a company from the ground-up. 

About the role: 
As to be expected in a fast moving start-up, the scope of this position will evolve continuously. Comfort with ambiguity is required. Below is a partial description of the valuable qualities we are looking for in a candidate for a Back End Engineer:

Consistent track record of designing, developing, testing, deploying, maintaining, and improving software

Comfort leading individual project priorities, deadlines and results

Consistent track record of execution and delivery; ability to get stuff done 

Development process flexibility; ability to build software in fast iterative cycles 

Demonstrated passion for coding and problem solving, either within a startup environment and/or side projects in an academic environment

Strength in collaborating multi-functionally across engineering, design, and product

Option to work remotely or from our Palo Alto, CA office

A great candidate for this position has: 

BS degree in Computer Science, similar technical field of study or equivalent practical experience. 

Software development experience in one or more general purpose programming languages. 

Experience working with two or more from the following: Unix/Linux environments, distributed and parallel systems, machine learning, information retrieval, natural language processing, networking, developing large software systems, and/or security software development. 

A working proficiency and communication skills in verbal and written English

Bonus points for Kotlin, Java, JVM, Node and Docker

Tech Stack
Backend: Kotlin, Flyway, jOOQ, Gradle, Node 

Infrastructure: AWS, Postgres, DynamoDB, Redis, Lambda, Kubernetes, Vault, Consul, Terraform, Spinnaker 

Front End: Typescript, React, Redux

Not everyone will match the above qualifications 100%. If your experiences don’t perfectly align, but you think you’d be a great fit, we’d still love to hear from you.

Airkit is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, or veteran status.

fields.description:
Airkit Logo
Apply Now
Full Stack Engineer
at Airkit (View all jobs)
Work from anywhere
About Us
Airkit began in 2017 when co-founders Adam Evans and Stephen Ehikian got fed up with frustrating customer experiences.  They couldn’t understand why, in the age of big data, AI, cloud-computing, and connected products, their interactions with companies were so impersonal, reactive, and time-consuming.  

Our team previously founded and built RelateIQ (sold to Salesforce in 2014). They’ve witnessed first-hand the evolution of the relationship between companies and customers. Everyone and everything are now connected, and customer expectations are soaring.  

Located in Palo Alto, CA, our company is on a mission to empower companies to build experiences people love. We are looking for smart and ambitious individuals who want to help build a company from the ground up.    

A great candidate for this position has: 
As to be expected in a fast moving start-up, the scope of this position will evolve continuously. Comfort with ambiguity is required. Below is a partial description of the important qualities we are looking for in the ideal candidate:
Proven ability to design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and improve software
Comfort managing individual project priorities, deadlines and deliverables 
Track record of execution and delivery; ability to get stuff done 
Development process flexibility; ability to build software in fast iterative cycles 
Demonstrated passion for coding and problem solving, either within a startup environment and/or side projects in an academic environment
Strength in collaborating cross-functionally across engineering, design, and product
Option to work remotely or from our Palo Alto, CA office
Minimum Qualifications
BS degree in Computer Science, similar technical field of study or equivalent practical experience. 
Software development experience in one or more general purpose programming languages. 
Experience working with two or more from the following: web application development, Unix/Linux environments, mobile application development, distributed and parallel systems, machine learning, information retrieval, natural language processing, networking, developing large software systems, and/or security software development. 
Working proficiency and communication skills in verbal and written English.
Tech Stack
Backend: Kotlin, Gradle, Node 
Infrastructure: AWS, Postgres, DynamoDB, Redis, Lambda, Kubernetes, Vault, Consul, Terraform, Spinnaker 
Front End: Typescript, React, Redux, Socket.io
Not everyone will match the above qualifications 100%. If your experiences don’t perfectly align, but you think you’d be a great fit, we’d still love to hear from you.

Airkit is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. fields.description:
3+ years history of development full-stack applications. Expertise in Java required.Demonstrated track record of successfully developing full-stack features by writing code that is readable, testable, maintainable, and scalableExpert at delivering high-quality features on ambitious timelinesDemonstrated knowledge and hands-on experience across the full application stack with some of the following languages/frameworks   UI: JavaScript, TypeScript, React, Angular, Vue, jquery  API: Java, Sprint, C#, .NET, Node.jsDatabases: SQL, MySQL, SQL Server, MongoDB, cloud-native databasesKnowledge of cloud infrastructure (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) or DevOps (e.g., Jenkins, Docker, Circle CI, Travis) is a plusExperience writing unit tests with major frameworks (Karma, JUnit, NUnit, MSTest) and practicing test-driven Experience working in Agile teams including active participation in sprint ceremonies (Daily Standup, Backlog Refinement, Retrospectives)Experience pair programming collaboratively with other developers, experience working with technical and non-technical colleaguesProven record of leadership in a work setting and/or through extracurricular activitiesSkills to communicate complex ideas effectively Undergraduate degree; or equivalent experienceWilling to travel 

WHO YOU'LL WORK WITH
You’ll work with McKinsey Digital in one of our North American offices. 

McKinsey Digital brings together the best of McKinsey’s tech and analytics capabilities to help our clients use digital technology to transform their businesses. As part of this group, you’ll join a global team working on everything from IT modernization and strategy to agile, cloud, cybersecurity, and digital transformation. You’ll typically work on projects across all industries and functions and will be fully integrated with the rest of our global firm.

You’ll also work with colleagues from across McKinsey & Company to help our clients deliver breakthrough products, experiences, and businesses.

Our office culture is casual, fun and social, with an emphasis on education and innovation. We have the freedom to try new ideas, experiment and are expected to be constantly learning and growing. There is also a strong emphasis on mentoring others in the group, enabling them to grow and learn. 

WHAT YOU'LL DO
You will work with clients in a wide range of sectors and industries, advising them on how to best use technology. 

We work in small cross-functional teams in a highly collaborative way, and enjoy seeing the direct impact from our work. You’ll use your technical skills in an Agile environment to turn clients’ ambitions into reality. This includes hands-on, ground up development as well as coaching and mentoring our client teams to enable best practices while working towards delivering new software products and services.

Along with developing clients’ technical capabilities, you’ll also change their cultures. From individual coaching to team mentoring, you’ll work to ensure a lasting change to the way clients work.

Software Architect - Site Reliability Engineering
Prague
Apply Now
QUALIFICATIONS
Experience with DevOps processes and cultureExperience with DevOps tools for CI/CD, version control, Infrastructure as Code (e.g. GoCD, GitHub, Ansible, Terraform)Hands on experience with at least one of the major cloud providers (AWS, Azure, GCP)5+ years of experience in software engineering (e.g. Python, Go, Node.js, Ruby, and others)Comfortable in writing Infrastructure as Code using the same code quality and engineering practices expected from core application developers (Test driven development, Integration, Security, Acceptance testing)Understanding of web and database technologies, concepts and design elements of on premise, cloud based and hybrid architecturesStrong understanding of presentation tiers (Apache, Tomcat, Nginx, IIS)Experience with containerized environments (Kubernetes, Docker)Understanding of standard networking protocols and components such as: HTTP, DNS, TCP/IP, ICMP, Load Balancing and WAFKnowledge of (shell) scripting languages (e.g. Bash, PowerShell, Perl or other)Working experience with monitoring and data analysis tools (e.g. Splunk, Prometheus, Grafana, AppDynamics, ...)
WHO YOU'LL WORK WITH
You’ll join our Prague office as part of our Cloud Native Tribe.
This team is responsible for developing and operating private and public cloud hosting services. Your team members are located in different locations across the world (Germany, USA, Costa Rica, India). 
WHAT YOU'LL DO
As our company is moving fast from traditional IT world to digital era, you will use your developer skills and Site Reliability Engineering mindset to help us with the transformation. 
You will be working on a newly established Cloud Native Tribe. Together with the team you will build and run a self-service infrastructure orchestration layer on top of our on-premise IaaS and cloud providers, following the SRE model. You will actively contribute to and learn multiple technology skills (cloud, orchestration, network, operating system) with a strong focus on open source products.

You will develop a vision for SRE within our organization, and you'll be a coach/mentor and help fellow team members to grow. You will be working with various product teams with focus on high application reliability, scalability and availability running in container infrastructure. You will be asked to  manage multiple complex projects and deadlines simultaneously. 

Additionally, you will focus heavily on automation and orchestration strategy for existing and new McKinsey IT infrastructure and contribute to Infrastructure as a code. 
Industries
High Tech
Functions
TechnologyApply Now
FOR U.S. APPLICANTS: McKinsey & Company is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

FOR NON-U.S. APPLICANTS: McKinsey & Company is an Equal Opportunity employer. For additional details regarding our global EEO policy and diversity initiatives, please visit our McKinsey Careers and Diversity & Inclusion sites.

Software Developer
Location:	Princeton, NJ, United States
Job ID:	2381
Number Of Positions:	1
START YOUR APPLICATION
Altimetrik is one of the fastest growing technology companies with a unique culture of combining people, creativity, and technology to ignite transformation. Teams developed in Altimetrik build innovative software solutions for the world's largest financial services, manufacturing, healthcare and retail companies. We place great importance on client relationships and have benefited from strong organic growth, which have allowed us to build a large blue-chip client base comprised of leading global companies across industries. Headquartered in Southfield, Michigan, Altimetrik is spread across the globe in the USA (Southfield, Princeton & San Francisco), India (Bengaluru, Chennai, Pune & Mumbai), Uruguay (Montevideo), Singapore and UAE (Sharjah) with a workforce of 2000 employees.

Design and develop MyCIO portal that will be used by Command center
Work with customer product stake holders to fully understand business requirements to develop, architecture and design new systems
Ensure phased development delivery plan is executed on schedule and support the product implementation process and tools
Design and development of the complete application from the start on already implemented company products.
Meeting with business teams to understand the required functionality and prepare documentation to be presented in an efficient way. Work with business analysts to prepare the final requirement gathering documents and convert them to technical documents.
Design backend database
Develop Data integrations
Develop, create, and modify general computer applications software or specialized utility programs.
Design and Develop API / micro services for each endpoint and ensure the implementation through acceptance testing, load testing etc.
Provide KPI’s (Key Performance Indicator) to the load testing teams, development teams and derive metrics. Review the metrics to make sure the expected results are achieved.
Provide SLA’s (Service Level Agreement), successful, failure and failover scenarios.
Develop acceptance tests using Postman based upon user story acceptance criteria and integrate them in CI/CD Pipelines for automatic testing of code.
Mentor and guide the development team to perform the code development in a timely manner without compromising with the deadlines.
 

Basic qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software engineering or a related field

Altimetrik is an equal opportunity employer committed to a culturally diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status or protected veteran status or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

Job Description
Accertify Inc. a wholly owned subsidiary of American Express, is a leader in providing software, tools and strategies for preventing online fraud and mitigating enterprise-wide risks. Accertify is committed to providing e-commerce companies with comprehensive and cost-effective solutions to fraud.
 
Accertify’s development team is looking for a skilled software engineer. This individual will use their software development background and strong analytical skills to help build and enhance Accertify’s industry-leading tools. This individual’s day-to-day work will involve using Java, JavaScript, HTML5, CSS, SQL, Linux, git and gradle to design and build software solutions that are fast, scalable and flexible.
 
As a part of the team, you will:
Work with business representatives, Lead Developers, and the Director of Software Development to design, build and test new products and features
Use the IDE of your choice to write code in Java, Javascript, HTML and css
Participate in the development and testing of internal tools, scripts and other coding projects
Work independently or on small team projects
Participate in peer code reviews
Troubleshoot and optimize code for usability, performance, and scalability
We seek individuals with strong fundamental programming experience, great communication skills, and a love for working on challenging problems.

Minimum Qualifications
Required Skills/Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science
Very strong and demonstrable analytical, problem solving, and debugging skills
Professional programming experience in an enterprise setting
2+ years software development experience as a Java developer
Knowledge of the basic Web technologies: HTML, CSS, Javascript
Familiarity with basic programming constructs (conditionals, loops, data structures)
Experience in Linux OS and command line operations
Strong Relational database skills (SQL, JDBC - Oracle and PostgreSQL preferred)
Working knowledge of industry standard formats, especially XML, CSV, and JSON; this includes understanding of character encodings like UTF-8 and ISO-Latin 1
Desired Skills:

Experience with Python or Groovy
Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions. 

American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.

Front-End Developer
 Itasca, Illinois
 Consulting, Operations
 20007703
 Get Referred
 Get Job Alerts
Job Description
Accertify Inc. a wholly owned subsidiary of American Express, is a leader in providing software, tools and strategies for preventing online fraud and mitigating enterprise-wide risks. Accertify is committed to providing e-commerce companies with comprehensive and cost-effective solutions to fraud.
 
Accertify’s development team is looking for a skilled software engineer. This individual will use their software development background and strong analytical skills to help build and enhance Accertify’s industry-leading tools. This individual’s day-to-day work will involve using Java, JavaScript, HTML5, CSS, SQL, Linux, git and gradle to design and build software solutions that are fast, scalable and flexible.
 
As a part of the team, you will:
Work with business representatives, Lead Developers, and the Director of Software Development to design, build and test new products and features
Use the IDE of your choice to write code in Java, Javascript, HTML and css
Participate in the development and testing of internal tools, scripts and other coding projects
Work independently or on small team projects
Participate in peer code reviews
Troubleshoot and optimize code for usability, performance, and scalability
We seek individuals with strong fundamental programming experience, great communication skills, and a love for working on challenging problems.

Minimum Qualifications
Required Skills/Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science
Very strong and demonstrable analytical, problem solving, and debugging skills
Professional programming experience in an enterprise setting
2+ years software development experience as a Java developer
Knowledge of the basic Web technologies: HTML, CSS, Javascript
Familiarity with basic programming constructs (conditionals, loops, data structures)
Experience in Linux OS and command line operations
Strong Relational database skills (SQL, JDBC - Oracle and PostgreSQL preferred)
Working knowledge of industry standard formats, especially XML, CSV, and JSON; this includes understanding of character encodings like UTF-8 and ISO-Latin 1
Desired Skills:

Experience with Python or Groovy
Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.

Job Description:
Front End React Developer

With the news of COVID19 spreading, Aquent is committed to ensuring the safety and well being of our employees. This includes providing technology to support video interviews, resources and support for employees to work from home successfully, and fully covered healthcare for eligible employees. 

 

Our Aquent Software Development Center is looking for a Front End Developer to join the team. This is a LONG TERM opportunity with great benefits!  (W2 Only, No C2C)

 

Aquent IT Solutions: Where Vision Becomes Reality

Do you know JavaScript, React/Redux, single page application? Are you interested in working with a group of fun people who are rooted in design and building web apps for Fortune 100 companies? If so, then this may be the role for you!

We are looking for a Front-End Web Developer who understands UX design, with 2-3 years of exp with good exposure to React/Redux/TDD/ Internationalization, and can craft visual components using advanced front-end technologies.

What You'll Do

This position requires a problem-solver with solid experience in web technologies, browsers, and user interface principles, including:

Duties/Responsibilities:

Working as bridge between UX Design and Application implementation with heavy React/Redux/TDD functions without excessive supervision
Working along with enterprise Front-End architects
Understanding concepts such as mobile first, responsive design
Refactoring of complex features to help improve their structure and maintainability
Practice and experience Test Driven Development (TDD) and Unit Test frameworks
Ensuring code quality and application performance
Peer code reviews
Working with Agile team members and stakeholders. Story grooming and relative estimation with team
Working as a team player focusing on reuse, performance, standards and delivery timeline
Anchor technical discussion, lead team of developers towards successful solution implementation
Excellent communication and documentation skills
What’s Required

Experience with the following skills is required:

JavaScript (expert level)
2-3 years of exp with good exposure to React/Redux/TDD
jQuery
Node.js
HTML5, CSS3
GIT
React/Redux/Hooks or Angular
Design patterns
Swagger.io
 

Note: We understand that Java development is more like an art of development and implementation, number of years in the experience is important but we are ready to talk to you even if you are new to this field but have strong expertise of required skills rooted within you.

 

Familiarity with one or more is desirable:

REST, Web services / microservice architecture
GIT, Jenkins, Maven, CI
Cloud development AWS or Azure and infrastructure as code
Angular
Java
Databases
Security implementation using OKTA
 
**( W2 Only- No C2C, Must be On-site at Work Location) 

Required: You will be required to complete a coding test assessment.

Client Description:
Why Aquent IT Solutions

Aquent IT Solutions operates a mission-critical application development center and consulting firm headquartered in East Moline, IL in the Quad Cities (QC). We offer challenging opportunities in front-end and back-end web application development, UX design, project management, business analysis, business intelligence, big data, and more. We have an engaging work environment, a diverse and comfortable community of affordable living, minimal commuting, quality education, and great entertainment. As a credit to our philosophy, many Aquent IT Solutions employees are in their second decade of employment with our company.

Job Description:
With the news of COVID19 spreading, Aquent is committed to ensuring the safety and well being of our employees. This includes providing technology to support video interviews, resources and support for employees to work from home successfully, and fully covered healthcare for eligible employees. The position is remote until the stay at home order is lifted. Then you must be able to work onsite at the posted location. 

Come join one of the most successful tech companies in the world! They are after a Front End Developer to support internal wiki pages and external, consumer facing sites as well. 

The Creative Department in Comms is looking for a junior to mid-level Front-end developer to help with internal and external web projects. The Developer’s primary role will be working with graphic designers and key stakeholders to transform content ideas into working HTML and CSS that is compatible with our internal wiki system as well as PHP and Javascript on our internal stack for external sites.

Responsibilities:

Develop new user-facing web features for our internal wiki system and external sites
Build reusable code libraries for future use
Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs
Ability to turn high fidelity mocks into pixel perfect web apps 
Apply HTML, CSS, PHP, and JS to create a high-quality finished product
Able to work cross-functionally with multiple stakeholders, project lead/manage, and communicate effectively and efficiently
Coordinate with project managers, designers, and policy managers to ensure deliverables are understood and milestones are met with consistency and accuracy
Demonstrate excellent organizational skills with the ability to handle multiple projects in a fast-paced environment
Requirements:

2+ year’s experience translating graphical designs to working web sites with a portfolio or samples of past work and projects
Working knowledge of React.js and PHP with Hack.
Web speed best practices.
SEO optimization. 
Proficient understanding HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript 
Proficient understanding of cross-browser compatibility issues and ways to work around them.
Ability to adapt to different situations fluidly
Highly self-motivated and self-directed with the ability to exercise independent judgment
Excellent self-starter, creative problem solver and collaborator
Preferred:

Familiarity with software like Adobe Suite (Photoshop, illustrator) and Sketch
Ability to design high fidelity mockups
Experience creating websites from wireframes to fully functioning web pages
Experience working with stakeholders and large teams
Ability to take on other miscellaneous design projects for the team
Education:

Not Required
Client Description:
This TOP social media company, headquartered in Menlo Park, CA, was built to help people connect and share. Over the last decade their tools have played a critical part in changing how people around the world communicate. With over two billion people using the service and more than fifty offices around the globe, a career at this company offers countless ways to make an impact in a fast growing organization.

Working here, you’ll:

Be part of their mission of community building
Work on the most visible apps and services in the social media industry  
Work in an Agile environment, in constant iteration and problem solving mode
Take part in global internal conversations that are happening with stakeholders, wherever they may be located, who are the best at what they do
Why work with AQUENT? Check out our awesome benefits: https://aquent.com/find-work/talent-benefits

Aquent is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.

Job Description:
Our south-end retail client is seeking a Web Producer to join their team for a 6-month assignment. You will be contributing to our client's success by authoring, scheduling, and launching content on their website using their CMS and related tools. The ideal candidate should have a working knowledge of web content management and publishing systems and familiarity with CMS workflows, ecommerce site architecture and folder structures, HTML, CSS and related libraries (Bootstrap), JavaScript and related libraries (JQuery, Riot, etc).

The web producer executes the creation and maintenance of the HTML, CSS and JavaScript for existing pages, new projects and emerging programs through a content management and publishing tool. This person will need to deliver projects on time, which adhere to project requirements with standards compliant code. The ideal candidate for this position has a strong business acumen, excellent oral and written communication and the ability to use critical thinking skills to proactively problem-solve, mitigate business risk and assure deliverables meet project timelines.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Support execution of Site Production projects by adding assets, setting template configurations and publishing content using CMS and other publishing tools  
Some advanced CMS authoring scenarios (custom HTML, CSS, JS)
Code HTML banners for use on search pages (top banners, spot 6s, bottom banners)
Write custom HTML snippets for placements that can’t be authored using existing widgets
Participate in Site Production projects from beginning to end, including project kickoff, reviews, technical execution and post launch support
Translate creative mockups/wireframes in order to author digital experiences based on design specs and template/technical markup compliance.
Work closely with interactive designer and copywriter to ensure their layouts are being translated as expected.
Identify opportunities to enhance templates based on recognition of unmet business and creative requirements
Coordinate website launch support for new content and promotional launches
Handle a high volume of concurrent projects, while maintaining transparency with task/project status reporting
Perform quality assurance review of requests before content is pushed live
Optimize images for web use
Add and validate analytics clicks and page load tracking to page and content
Ensure published content meets SEO, accessibility and web performance best practices
Anticipate, prevent, and troubleshoot issues
Contribute to and maintain CMS and team how-to guides
Collaborate and maintain close relationships with cross-functional teams to maximize reach of web content efforts and ensure alignment across channels and teams
Utilizes familiarity with CMS workflows, ecommerce site architecture and folder structures, CSS, Bootstrap classes to author digital experiences based on design specs and widget/technical markup compliance.
Executes work effectively by using resources efficiently, meeting deadlines, and keeping others informed of work plans and progress toward goals.
Proven ability to organize, self-govern and identify and troubleshoot solutions for digital production challenges.
Works closely with interactive designer and copywriter to ensure their layouts are being translated as expected.
Accountable to be on call for site issues outside of business hours
Use sound business judgment to make quick decisions under pressure in ambiguous circumstances.

2-5+ years of relevant experience 
CMS experience (Bloomreach/Hippo preferred)
Some technical hard coding experience

Figma experience, experience working closely with a creative team (preferred)

fields.description:
Frontend Software Engineer
at Armory
USA, Canada, Mexico, Remote
Do you want to work with people who love what they do while building a product that has real impact?
We're looking for passionate, product-focused frontend software engineers who have hacked systems in creative ways, who are curious about new languages, technologies, and trends.
We believe that working hard is a byproduct of loving what you do and not something that can be measured on a timesheet.
At Armory, you'll work in small, collaborative, agile teams, interface directly with customers, and build awesome products that address real problems. There are no facts in the building; everyone owns their own mistakes; we ship code continuously; we are a crew.
Do you have experience with some or most of the below? We'd love to talk!
 
3+ years experience
Deep domain expertise in JavaScript, HTML, CSS
React
Typescript
Restful APIs
Strong communication skills, able to communicate complex technical ideas to anyone, able to collaborate effectively with designers
 
Skills or experience in the following are a strong plus:
Cloud platforms
Docker or other container technology
Spinnaker
 
Our current front end tech stack is TypeScript and React, backed by JVM based web-services (mostly Java and Kotlin, some groovy), Go, Python, Kubernetes, SpringMVC, AWS and, of course, a strong focus on dog fooding our own continuous delivery tools. You don't have to know our exact tech stack, but you should be familiar with similar tools and willing to learn.
 
At Armory, our concept of diversity is broad. We understand that diversity comes in many forms and includes age, socioeconomic status, educational background, ethnic identity and national origin, marital and familial status, gender expression and identity, transgender status, disability status, religious affiliation, sex and sexual orientation, veteran status, neurodivergence, and mental health status. As we build a company that is both diverse and inclusive, we are also working on the way we communicate. There are challenges, stumbling blocks, and failings, but we are committed to learning and improving to make Armory a welcoming company.
This is a blog post from Armory’s CEO sharing his perspective of being an accomplice and not just an ally: https://drodio.com/be-a-diversity-and-inclusion-accomplice-not-just-ally/
 
Armory is a Series C startup backed by B-Capital, Insight, Crosslink Capital, Y Combinator (W17), Bain Capital, and Javelin Venture Partners based in San Mateo, CA. We believe software is the highest leverage way to improve humanity. So, we are building a platform that unlocks collaboration between your Dev, Sec, and Ops teams and tools, from Code to Cloud. Built on Spinnaker, our Policy-Driven Deployments enable you to innovate with speed & safety. Our platform automates software delivery to make engineers happy and productive.
 
Apply for this Job* Required

Email *
Phone *

Attach Dropbox Paste
LinkedIn Profile
GitHub Profile

Software Engineer (Backend/Node.js) for Growing Health Startup (remote / US-based)
$95k – $140k AngelList Est.
Apply now
Mental Health Match is fast-growing marketplace that simplifies the search for mental health care. Our unique platform and matching algorithm instantly match people to the therapists and counselors who best meet their needs, including budget/insurance, cultural fit, and expertise.

We are a mission-driven social enterprise with proven traction. Launched last year, over 1,000 therapists have joined the platform, and we have matched over 25,000 people to the mental health professionals who can best help them.

This backend role will work closely with our CTO to build, architect, and deploy new systems to fuel our next phase of our growth. They will work closely with our full team to make decisions about the product and help create a foundation to grow our technical team. The ideal candidate will be excited about getting a full 360 degree view of the product, market, and business they are a part of.

Your primary duties:

Your primary duties will involve the full range of development, deployment, and data management of a Node.js backend application.
You will also support infrastructure projects including implementing CI, improving automated testing, and preparing data for consumption by various machine learning methods.
*These responsibilities include: *

Help architect, build, and maintain our back-end API using Nodejs, JavaScript, Postgres, and various third-party integrations, including collaboration in database design.
Implement and maintain test suites
Collaborate on data architecture, product strategy and feature development, including adoption of new technologies.
Assist with managing, supporting and troubleshooting the infrastructure required to run these projects and ancillary technologies.
Help build and improve a robust set of systems and technologies required to run a startup with a small team.
Qualifications:

Node.js (3+ years, full-time work experience)
Javascript (3+years full-time work experience
Relational Databases: (3+ years full-time work experience)
This is a fully-remote position available to only permanent residents of the US (citizens or green card holders) who are currently living in the US. We cannot offer sponsorships such as H-1Bs.

Compensation
This is a full-time position. Compensation is a competitive salary plus equity options, subsidized health, dental, and vision insurance, and up to 5 weeks of annual vacation. We have a flexible work culture that supports the wellbeing of our employees and healthy work-life balance.

To apply:
Please send a resume and links to relevant projects you are proud of to: hiring@mentalhealthmatch.com.

About Us
We're reimagining the way people and businesses spend money online using ephemeral card numbers.

We're a close-knit (32-person), rapidly growing company backed by top tier investors looking to expand our engineering team to keep pace with our growth. We believe that there is an enormous opportunity to improve the lives of millions of people by building financial tools that are both safe and delightful to use.

As an early member of the team, you will make a significant impact on both the product and culture. You'll have the chance to work on a multitude of interesting challenges across card processing, API architecture, fraud and abuse detection, scaling, and new product development.

About the role
As a software engineer at Privacy, you should be just as comfortable working with Javascript callbacks as you are with multiprocessing in python, as well as wearing the occasional DevOps hat. Depending on your interests, you'll have the opportunity to work on a variety of areas and languages, including:

Improving our fraud modeling and ML classifiers that detect anomalous behavior and prevent fraud
Updates to our real-time transaction processing engine with millisecond response times
New features for both the hundreds of thousands of consumers using our product and the hundreds of businesses using our API
Building out growth hooks, A/B testing and supporting growth and retention efforts
What we're looking for

2+ years of experience shipping code in a production environment
Proficiency in at least one language - we work in Javascript / Python / C++ / Java / SQL, but care much more general engineering skill than knowledge of a particular language or framework.
An understanding of the balance between perfection and shipping quickly
Awareness that code is written as much for humans to read and maintain as it is for machines to interpret
Ownership of the features from start to finish
Understanding of algorithms, systems, and design
Why apply?
In addition to competitive salary and equity we offer the following:

Flexible vacation policy; take time when you need it
Remote friendly
Paid parental leave
401(k) with employer contribution
Medical / dental / vision coverage
3% cashback on all purchases with Privacy
Choose your own Apple equipment
Commuter benefits
Conveniently located office in lower Manhattan near many trains
Privacy is an equal opportunity employer. We’re committed to ensuring a safe and inclusive workplace by welcoming people of all backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives. We encourage people from traditionally underrepresented groups to apply. If you have a disability or other need that requires accommodations in the application process, please let us know.

About Mighty:

Mighty is on a mission to help millions of injured plaintiffs get a better deal from the civil justice system. Today, our ownership management platform helps personal injury law firms, medical providers and financial service businesses manage their personal injury liens in more than 150,000 cases worth over $1 Billion. We are growing our team with the support of a $9M Series A led by IA Ventures and Tribeca Venture Partners in March 2018.

Mighty is looking for a self-starting engineer who has passion for leveraging technology to solve social problems. The ideal candidate possesses outstanding intellectual horsepower and loves the autonomy of owning projects. You’re the kind of person who enjoys getting their hands dirty, isn’t afraid to ask questions, is eager to learn and wants to contribute technical solutions to big hairy problems. The role can be based out of the NYC office or fully remote, if that’s the preference of the hire.

Responsibilities:

Contribute to our code base and ensure our coding standards are maintained through quality code reviews
Collaborate cross-functionally with Product, and Growth teams
Assist with ongoing software development initiatives and learn about our architecture, industry and use base
Requirements:

3+ years of prior engineering experience
Fluency in at least one of these languages: Python, Typescript, Javascript
Experience with OOP and exposure to FP
Experience building RESTful APIs
Experience with relational databases (PostgreSQL, MySQL, etc)
Comfort getting around a Linux-based cloud infrastructure
Exposure to Docker
Familiarity with a framework with Django, Rails, or a similar web framework
Benefits:

Competitive compensation
Full Benefits - health, vision, and dental, 401(k) with company contribution
Unlimited paid time off - take time when you need it

Stipend for home office furniture and accessories
Learning and Development opportunities
And more!

Our goal is to improve company outcomes & value for customers, employees, and shareholders. Starting a company has become easier, but growing a company is just as hard. We are bringing the best advice from venture capitalists, successful entrepreneurs, and CFOs to the fingertips of startups to help them grow from formation to IPO.

Puzzle is a young startup that is looking to fill out their first key engineering positions. This is an opportunity to help drive architecture, process and culture. We value technical ability, collaboration, and humility. We move fast and are driven to meet our goals.

Our founder built one of the largest YC companies that scaled from two people to hundreds, no customers to millions, raised over $500MM and wants to build something bigger. He had a nearly perfect rating on Glassdoor, building a high performance, low ego, diverse team.

You are self motivated and entrepreneurial. You can find answers on your own, but know when to ask for help. You are driven and passionate, and want to create a product our users love. And you love numbers over opinions (when you have them!).

We use TypeScript, Node, PostGres, Python, GraphQL, and React all on GCP - maybe that will change. You can be given a fuzzy feature - help define it and get it done. You aren't afraid to touch any part of our system. It’s early now - but we have a lot of interesting technology we need to build to get where we are going. We are small so you’ll get into some devops - but we strive for devops-0 - so we take advantage of services and automation so we can concentrate on building value, not reinventing the wheel.

This is your opportunity to be an early engineer at a well funded startup that has a successful founder, a drive to build a world class team, and an attractive equity package. We have room for senior folks with strong backgrounds to juniors that have drive and a will to learn.

We are going to win - and we’ll have fun along the way!

Apply now
Stealth(y) mode startup. Starting a company has become easier, but growing a company is more complicated than ever. We are rethinking the core financial infrastructure to improve company outcomes & increase value for customers, employees, and shareholders. We are bringing the best advice from venture capitalists, successful entrepreneurs, and CFOs to the fingertips of startups to help them grow from formation to IPO.

We will start by helping startups improve their financial performance, which determines a company’s ability to raise venture capital, at what valuation, which attracts great talent to the company and ultimately drives employee and investor returns.

Puzzle is a young startup that is looking to fill out their first key engineering positions. This is an opportunity to help drive architecture, process and culture. We value technical ability, collaboration, and humility. We move fast and are driven to meet our goals.

Our founder built one of the largest YC companies that scaled from two people to hundreds, no customers to millions, raised over $500MM and wants to build something bigger. He had a nearly perfect rating on Glassdoor, building a high performance, low ego, diverse team.

You are self motivated and entrepreneurial. You can find answers on your own, but know when to ask for help. You are driven and passionate, and want to create a product our users love. And you love numbers over opinions (when you have them!).

As our Backend Engineer you will help design and build our financial data system. We will be ingesting large amounts of data from disparate sources, correlating them, transforming them, and producing the core system for the rest of our products. We expect the data to be large, dirty, and difficult to wrangle. We want to be as real time as possible, event driven, and decoupled. Redundant and resistant. And accuracy is key.

But that’s half the fun. The other half is understanding how we can correlate that data to our financial models and building an efficient, scalable and provably correct system. We’d love to hear how your background and skills can be applied to our product.

This is your opportunity to be an early engineer at a well funded startup that has a successful founder, a drive to build a world class team, and an attractive equity package.

We are going to win - and we’ll have fun along the way!
